attributes.title: The Tragic True Story That Inspired Moby Dick - Ship Hits the Fan Podcast
attributes.caption: .Whales - 13, Whalers - 0.
attributes.description:
November 20, 1820 - An American whaleboat is attacked and destroyed, ironically, by a whale. What happens next is a harrowing account of survival that would go on to inspire one of the great American novels.

attributes.title: A 17th Century Shipwreck Turns Men into Monsters - Ship Hits the Fan Podcast
attributes.caption: Mutiny, backstabbing, and murder.
attributes.description:
June 4, 1629 - A ship loaded with treasure wrecks near a small island off the western coast of Australia. Many on board manage to escape and make their way to shore.  But that was just the beginning. What followed was a tale of mutiny, backstabbing and murder that has been called “one of the worst horror stories in maritime history.”

attributes.title: The Pride of the Swedish Empire Sinks Immediately - Ship Hits the Fan Podcast
attributes.caption: A lesson in what not to do.
attributes.description:
August 10, 1628 - The newly built warship, the Vasa, an incredibly ornate and well-armed ship that’s the pride of the Swedish Empire, sinks almost immediately after it launches. It’s an unmitigated disaster and an embarrassment for the king. And today, nearly 400 years later the Vasa is both a historical treasure and a lesson in what not to do.

attributes.title: Even Fertilizer Explosions Are Bigger in Texas - Ship Hits the Fan Podcast
attributes.caption: If the smoke is grey, watching’s okay. Purple & yellow? Get down, fellow.
attributes.description:
April 16, 1947 - A cargo ship filled with fertilizer prepares to leave the Texas coast en route to Europe, to help with the rebuilding effort after World War II. But before the ship leaves port, a small fire is spotted on board. What followed would be the deadliest industrial accident in American history.

attributes.title: An Unsinkable Russian Nuclear Sub Sinks Itself - Ship Hits the Fan Podcast
attributes.caption: Trapped in the belly of a sunken nuclear sub.
attributes.description:
August 12, 2000 - The Russian nuclear submarine, the Kursk, is taking part in a major fleet exercise when a pair of huge explosions rocks the craft. What happens next is one of the worst peacetime submarine accidents ever.

attributes.title: The SS Central America Sinks Itself and the U.S. Economy - Ship Hits the Fan Podcast
attributes.caption: A treasure hunt with a very dark beginning.
attributes.description:
Sept 12, 1857 - A sidewheel steamer named the SS Central America sinks off the coast of North Carolina. Hundreds of people died in what was one of the worst maritime disasters at the time. But also aboard the ship was millions of dollars in gold. What happened next would cause a financial meltdown in the US that would be felt for years to come.

attributes.title: Too Many Christmas Trees Sink The Rouse Simmons - Ship Hits the Fan Podcast
attributes.caption: Happy Holidays from the bottom of Lake Michigan.
attributes.description:
Nov 23, 1912 - A ship loaded with Christmas trees sinks in a violent storm on Lake Michigan. All on board were killed. But the wreck would become a legend that lives on to this day.

attributes.title: The Hōkūleʻa Fails to Shred the Gnar - Ship Hits the Fan Podcast
attributes.caption: Free admission to the museum of your mind.
attributes.description:
March 16th, 1978 - A traditional Hawaiian canoe left Honolulu with plans to travel to Tahiti using only ancient navigation methods and the tools of their ancestors. Only a few hours later the boat capsized, and one crew member would never be seen again.

attributes.description:

attributes.title: The SS Yongala Is Lost for Forty-Seven Years - Ship Hits the Fan Podcast
attributes.caption: "We should all stay away from the oceans, horses, and guys..."
attributes.description:
March 23rd, 1911 - A cargo ship carrying forty-nine passengers, seventy-three crew members, and one famous racing horse, Set out from Mackay, Australia. Within hours the ship and all aboard had mysteriously disappeared, only to be discovered forty-seven years later.

attributes.title: The Real Story of the USS Indianapolis Part 1 - Ship Hits the Fan Podcast
attributes.caption: The USS Indianapolis is sunk in shark infested waters.
attributes.description:
The USS Indianapolis set out from San Francisco to Pearl Harbor on a top secret mission. Two weeks later the Indianapolis had sunk, and her crew had spent three harrowing days in shark infested waters. The world would never be the same again.

attributes.title: The Real Story of the USS Indianapolis Part 2 - Ship Hits the Fan Podcast
attributes.caption: A mission so secret, no distress call could be sent.
attributes.description:
July 28th, 1945 - The USS Indianapolis set out from Guam after dropping off the components for the bomb destined for Hiroshima. Two days later, the Indianapolis had sunk. A third of her crew was dead and the rest clung desperately to life boats as the sharks circled.

attributes.caption: Only the hottest in Navy fanfiction.
attributes.description:

attributes.caption: Claw machines vs poop bombs.
attributes.description:

attributes.title: A History of Cats at Sea - Ship Hits the Fan Podcast
attributes.caption: Cat’s pillage our hearts as we follow their history on the high seas.
attributes.description:
The sea can be a vast lonely place. Boats filled with rats, trash, and sailors desperate for companionship became the perfect place for our modern furry friends to flourish. How do you hoist a mainsail if you don’t have opposable thumbs? We’ll find out when cats sail the high seas.
